title: Belarusian language
summary: Belarusian (/ˌbɛləˈruːsiən, -ˈruːʃən, -ˈrʌʃən/;[5] in Belarusian: беларуская мова, "bielaruskaja mova", IPA: [bʲɛlaˈruskaja ˈmɔva]) is an East Slavic language of the Indo-European language family and is one of the Slavic languages, which are part of a larger Balto-Slavic branch. It is the native language of Belarusians and one of the two official languages in the Republic of Belarus under the current Constitution (Article 17), along with Russian. Additionally, it is spoken in some parts of Russia, Lithuania, Latvia, Poland, and Ukraine by Belarusian minorities in those countries.
